channel.title: SCARBrowser.exe - virus warning
channel.description:
It has come to my attention that SCARBrowser.exe, the program which i created and is included with srl is being detected by virusscanners, supposingly being a trojan. Before anyone posts about this, i already posted my statement on the srl boards, and i will repeat it here.
I have closely looked into this matter and i can say without a doubt that if there is a virus, then it should not be able to harm anyone. The virus i traced back into my project, clearly the last compiled version of SCARBrowser.exe, which i added to srl had this issue, the best explanation i myself can come up with is that malfunction in the compiling process of the file caused it to have a virus-like signature and therefor triggering virus scanners. I have recompiled the program and ran it trough jotti.org's powerfull scanning process, which indicated that the file is clean. This new version will be included with the next version of srl. If however you have concerns about the current SCARBrowser.exe file, then you should not hesitate to remove it, because it is of no use in it's current state.
And srr for this inconveniance, i should've checked if it was working right before the release of the new srl.

item.title: SCARBrowser.exe - virus warning
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Dukly:

good job freddy, the old one was detected from the SCAR updater? I havent really looked into it yet, but i see everyone else has, good job people.

why the hell do you bring this thread up?
ther eis no virus, there never has been one, it was a compiling error which created a virus like signature, i didn’t even notice it until someone brought it up

Read full topic

item.title: SCARBrowser.exe - virus warning
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:32, topic:11036”][quote author=zoss0 link=topic=16325.msg208580#msg208580 date=1157213988]

There is no way freddy put a virus in his program, if he was going to do somthing like that he would have done it over a year ago.

No need for any more accusations, its not a virus.

But but but…Waaa! Mummy mopar told me off!
Lol…
Anyways. Why did it come up in my registry/System Restore? If it’s not a virus, how come it puts itself in the regi?
[/quote]
Because you made it up? The program doesn’t preform any tasks that remotely involve the registry.[/quote]
So…should I get proof?

Read full topic

Because you made it up? The program doesn’t preform any tasks that remotely involve the registry.

hell i could write a program that is instead a java app that can take orders like change world, ect. it would just be the applet as a window on the screen, nothing around the applet, no title, min/max. i could even set it as top perm. :)[/quote]
Congratz.

Read full topic

item.title: SCARBrowser.exe - virus warning
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“sup000, post:27, topic:11036”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=16325.msg201880#msg201880 date=1157054560]

wtf is Scarbrowser.exe anyhoo?

It’s an independant program which contains a webbrowser that can be controlled by scar
[/quote]

sorry, give me 2 weeks when i can actually get back home and use my own pc, i will take a look, but what do you mean controlled by scar? it it just a webbrowser launcher?[/quote]
It’s just a program with a build-in webbrowser control, you can choose between either a normal ie control or a mozilla control, the program can be commanded by functions build into srl (using interscarcommunication) to browse, go back, forward, stop, etc…

Read full topic

Nox, as i said before, this whatever it was will be fixed in the next version of srl, the reason it doesn’t work at jotti is because the whole file is screwed.
